page.title: 16HOUSES IN SOUTHALL
page.content: {A SURVEY OF 35 HOUSES IN ASCOT GDNS. {SOUTHALL} -Barry Clarke All houses were terraced apart from three that were semi-detached. 94% had pebble dashed walls. The new style of double glazing was quite popular, but still the majority of people had old wooden windows. Where I live people like gardening because only a few didn't have flowery gardens (back or front). These houses were mainly surrounded by a wall or hedge. Nearly every house had either a garage or a shed. {RESULTS OF MY SURVEY} The houses had the following features: Extention 26%, Terraced 89%, Semis.9%, Pebb.dashed 94%, Stone clad9%, Garage 89%, Doub.glaze 37%, Old windows 77%, Fences 74%, Cultivated 63%, Uncultivated 26%, Walls 69%, Hedges26% Slate roof 71%, Tiled roof 29%.
